Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Android Emulator crashes Windows" (#3079) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm not exactly sure whether this belongs here, but here I go. Also, I'm not alone.
If this isn't the correct place, please suggest where can I report it.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Normal use of Android Emulator under Hyper-V

### Expected Behavior

No BSOD

### Actual Behavior

Occasionally the emulator will cause BSOD. Getting SYNTHETIC_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT (1ca) BSOD code.

### Version Information

Emulator is 29.0.8 but it happens with earlier ones as well.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[tests] Run locale test with AOT enabled too" (#3094) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Commit
https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/74cf0ec949783f2b70b9541a24ebea304dc9e6eb
started running the locale test non-parallel to have *sane* time
measurements.

It will be nice to have the AOT and profiled AOT times for locale test
as well.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Jenkins master build shouldn't upload `bundle-*.zip` unless it is "new"" (#3095) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Currently the Jenkins/master build *always* uploads a `bundle-*.zip`, even if it hasn't "really" changed.  What happens is:

 1. The existing `bundle-*.zip` is downloaded into `$HOME/android-archives`
 2. The file from (1) is extracted into e.g. `bin/Debug`
 3. Later, `bin/BuildDebug/bundle-*.zip` is created, using the contents from (2).
 4. (3) is uploaded and becomes the "new" `bundle-*.zip`

The result is that `bundle-*.zip` changes with *every master build*, which means it's ~constantly "changing" -- though only *timestamps* within the file changes; no other contents change -- which makes for some "bizarro" environmental conditions.

If (1) & (2) happens, we should *skip* (3) & (4).

Can you please check whether the issue is included in the mentioned version too?

Please revert us asap.

Regards,
Dinesh Babu Yadav (Syncfusion Support Team)

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "PropertyChanged with propertyName="" is not refreshing binded properties" (#5121) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
When PropertyChanged is called with propertyName="" ALL properties are considered as changed. 
That should trigger all binded properties on the XAML Page to refresh.

### Expected Behavior
1. this.PropertyChanged?.Invoke(this, new PropertyChangedEventArgs(""));
2. Binded XMAL properties values should change

### Actual Behavior
1. this.PropertyChanged?.Invoke(this, new PropertyChangedEventArgs(""));
2. Binded XMAL properties values did not change

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.0.0.8055-pre1, 4.0.0.8055-pre2, 4.0.0.8055-pre3
- Last known good version: 3.4.0.1029999
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - iOS:  12.1

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] iPad - Entry: Keyboard.Telephone & Keyboard.Numeric display standard keyboard instead of phone/numeric keyboards" (#6202) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

In a Forms Entry box, Keyboard.Telephone & Keyboard.Numeric display standard keyboard instead of phone/numeric keyboards on iPad. I didn't notice this issue on iPhone. 

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open and build UITest > FormsGallery sample in the reproduction link. (Might also be reproducible generally in an Entry field set to Keyboard.Telephone/.Numeric)
2. Go to "Views for Editing Text > Entry (single line) > Enter phone number"

### Expected Behavior
Display a telephone styled keypad (or a numeric keypad when switched to that) on iPad & iPhone

### Actual Behavior
Full keyboard is displayed on iPad, telephone styled keypad displayed on iPhone. (I didn't double-check Numeric on iPhone.)

### Basic Information
Reproduced using:
- Xamarin.Forms 3.6.0.344457
- iPad Pro (12.9-inch) (3rd Generation) simulator (iOS 12.1)
- Xcode 10.2.1
- Xamarin.iOS 12.8.0.2

- Last known good version: Unknown
- IDE: Visual Studio Community 2019 for Mac Version 8.0.5 (build 9)
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS:  
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices: iPad Pro (12.9-inch) (3rd Generation) simulator (iOS 12.1), possibly other iPads. 

### Screenshots
QuickTime screen recording demonstrating the issue:
[Forms keyboard bug repo.mov.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3184795/Forms.keyboard.bug.repo.mov.zip)

### Reproduction Link
https://github.com/King-of-Spades/AppCenter-Test-Samples/releases/tag/2.0-b5 
^ My port of the "Forms Gallery" open-source sample. Other sources of the Forms Gallery I suspect could reproduce the issue since I haven't customized this part of the app.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug] CollectionView doesn't reset the selection color" (#6128) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

CollectionView doesn't  reflect changes for the SelectedItem. Setting SelectedItem = null should clear the selection color.

### Steps to Reproduce

Run the attached sample project from either iOS simulator or device. 
Tap on a row, CollectionView does update but the code "SelectedItem = null" has not effect.

- Version with issue:
4.0.0 Pre Release 10
- IDE:
VS Mac
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - iOS:  12.2
- Nuget Packages:
4.0.0 Pre Release 10
- Affected Devices:
All

### Screenshots

![IMG_0042](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7459002/57370935-a9887600-7191-11e9-8d10-09aafc3a8364.jpg)

### Reproduction Link

[CollectionViewChallenge](https://github.com/b-straub/CollectionViewChallenge)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Enhancement] Allow to maually deselect item from CollectionView" (#6158) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
## Summary
In many scenarios developer would require to programmatically needs to deselect a selected item. I tried to do so by binding SelectedItem to a property in ViewModel. I am assigning it a value of null to deselect the selected item. But that does not work.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug] CollectionView doesn't reflect changes in an ObservableCollection itself" (#6126) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

CollectionView doesn't  reflect changes for the ObservableCollection itself, whereas changes in the content are reflected.

### Steps to Reproduce

Run the attached sample project from either iOS simulator or device. 
Tap on a row, CollectionView does update.
Tap on clear, CollectionView doesn't update.

Both the items and the collection are implementing the INotifyPropertyChanged interface.

- Version with issue:
4.0.0 Pre Release 10
- IDE:
VS Mac
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - iOS:  12.2
- Nuget Packages:
4.0.0 Pre Release 10
- Affected Devices:
All

### Screenshots

### Reproduction Link

[CollectionViewChallenge](https://github.com/b-straub/CollectionViewChallenge)

Events.RelatedBody: Generate binlogs to ensure that we can easily debug msbuild failures.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[XHarness] Do use the test dlls from the mono downloads." (#6055) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
This updates the project generation. We cannot yet fully remove the submodule because:

1. We are missing the xunit dlls which should be added in the SDK.
2. We have not yet remove all the old style tests. Would make the PR huge, better to deal with it in a diff PR.
3. The xunit CoreLib tests have issues loading all the tests, needs some extra work and again, the PR is already large.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[apidiff] Add q quick'n'dirty script to produce a diff between any two bundle.zip" (#6050) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Use for producing API diff for release notes without waiting for a PR,
bots and/or approvals...

Also useful to produce API diff between any versions, not just between
the current revision and a baseline (last stable).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "DidReceiveRemoteNotification crash app when receiving a pushnotification" (#6054) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce
 in  IOS build settings
1. linker behaviour set to "Link Framework sdk's only
2. strip native debugging symbols checked as the only one
3. send notfication to app 

### Expected Behavior
push notification is handled.
### Actual Behavior
App crashes with error 
`ObjCruntimeException has been thrown.
Unable to locate the block to delegate conversion method for the method DidreceiveRemoteNotificaion's parameter #3. Please file a bug at https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/new`
